intro: Harpalyce minor, commonly known as the small harpalyce, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, compound leaves and yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Harpalyce minor is often found in desert scrub and grassland ecosystems. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and can remain viable in the soil for several years.
